name: Acid Burrower
description: A horse-sized insect with digging claws and acidic blood.

features.name: Relentless
features.description: The Burrower can be spotlighted up to three times per GM turn. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

features.name: Earth Eruption
features.description: Mark a Stress to have the Burrower burst out of the ground. All creatures within Very Close range must succeed on an Agility Reaction Roll or be knocked over, making them Vulnerable until they next act.

features.name: Spit Acid
features.description: Make an attack against all targets in front of the Burrower within Close range. Targets the Burrower succeeds against take 2d6 physical damage and must mark an Armor Slot without receiving its benefi ts (they can still use armor to reduce the damage). If they can’t mark an Armor Slot, they must mark an additional HP and you gain a Fear.

features.name: Acid Bath
features.description: When the Burrower takes Severe damage, all creatures within Close range are bathed in their acidic blood, taking 1d10 physical damage. This splash covers the ground within Very Close range with blood, and all creatures other than the Burrower who move through it take 1d6 physical damage.

name: Bear
description: A large bear with thick fur and powerful claws.

features.name: Overwhelming Force
features.description: Targets who mark HP from the Bear’s standard attack are knocked back to Very Close range.

features.name: Bite
features.description: Mark a Stress to make an attack against a target within Melee range. On a success, deal 3d4+10 physical damage and the target is Restrained until they break free with a successful Strength Roll.

features.name: Momentum
features.description: When the Bear makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

name: Cave Ogre
description: A massive humanoid who sees all sapient life as food.

features.name: Ramp Up
features.description: You must spend a Fear to spotlight the Ogre. While spotlighted, they can make their standard attack against all targets within range.

features.name: Bone Breaker
features.description: The Ogre’s attacks deal direct damage.

features.name: Hail of Boulders
features.description: Mark a Stress to pick up heavy objects and throw them at all targets in front of the Ogre within Far range. Make an attack against these targets. Targets the Ogre succeeds against take 1d10+2 physical damage. If they succeed against more than one target, you gain a Fear.

features.name: Rampaging Fury
features.description: When the Ogre marks 2 or more HP, they can rampage. Move the Ogre to a point within Close range and deal 2d6+3 direct physical damage to all targets in their path.

name: Construct
description: A roughly humanoid being of stone and steel, assembled and animated by magic.

features.name: Relentless
features.description: The Construct can be spotlighted up to two times per GM turn. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

features.name: Weak Structure
features.description: When the Construct marks HP from physical damage, they must mark an additional HP.

features.name: Trample
features.description: Mark a Stress to make an attack against all targets in the Construct’s path when they move. Targets the Construct succeeds against take 1d8 physical damage.

features.name: Overload
features.description: Before rolling damage for the Construct’s attack, you can mark a Stress to gain a +10 bonus to the damage roll. The Construct can then take the spotlight again.

features.name: Death Quake
features.description: When the Construct marks their last HP, the magic powering them ruptures in an explosion of force. Make an attack with advantage against all targets within Very Close range. Targets the Construct succeeds against take 1d12+2 magic damage.

name: Courtier
description: An ambitious and ostentatiously dressed socialite.

features.name: Mockery
features.description: Mark a Stress to say something mocking and force a target within Close range to make a Presence Reaction Roll (14) to see if they can save face. On a failure, the target must mark 2 Stress and is Vulnerable until the scene ends.

features.name: Scapegoat
features.description: Spend a Fear and target a PC. The Courtier convinces a crowd or prominent individual that the target is the cause of their current confl ict or misfortune.

name: Deeproot Defender
description: A burly vegetable-person with grasping vines.

features.name: Ground Slam
features.description: Slam the ground, knocking all targets within Very Close range back to Far range. Each target knocked back this way must mark a Stress.

features.name: Grab and Drag
features.description: Make an attack against a target within Close range. On a success, spend a Fear to pull them into Melee range, deal 1d6+2 physical damag.

name: Dire Wolf
description: A large wolf with menacing teeth, seldom encountered alone.

features.name: Pack Tactics
features.description: If the Wolf makes a successful standard attack and another Dire Wolf is within Melee range of the target, deal 1d6+5 physical damage instead of their standard damage and you gain a Fear.

features.name: Hobbling Strike
features.description: Mark a Stress to make an attack against a target within Melee range. On a success, deal 3d4+10 direct physical damage and make them Vulnerable until they clear at least 1 HP.

name: Giant Mosquitoes
description: Dozens of fist-sized mosquitoes, flying together for protection.

features.name: Horde
features.description: When the Mosquitoes have marked half or more of their HP, their standard attack deals 1d4+1 physical damage instead.

features.name: Flying
features.description: While flying, the Mosquitoes have a +2 bonus to their Difficulty.

features.name: Bloodsucker
features.description: When the Mosquitoes’ attack causes a target to mark HP, you can mark a Stress to force the target to mark an additional HP.

name: Giant Rat
description: A cat-sized rodent skilled at scavenging and survival.

features.name: Minion
features.description: The Rat is defeated when they take any damage. For every 3 damage a PC deals to the Rat, defeat an additional Minion within range the attack would succeed against.

features.name: Group Attack
features.description: Spend a Fear to choose a target and spotlight all Giant Rats within Close range of them. Those Minions move into Melee range of the target and make one shared attack roll. On a success, they deal 1 physical damage each. Combine this damage.

name: Giant Scorpion
description: A human-sized arachnid with tearing claws and a stinging tail.

features.name: Double Strike
features.description: Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against two targets within Melee range.

features.name: Venomous Stinger
features.description: Make an attack against a target within Very Close range. On a success, spend a Fear to deal 1d4+4 physical damage and Poison them until their next rest or they succeed on a Knowledge Roll (16). While Poisoned, the target must roll a d6 before they make an action roll. On a result of 4 or lower, they must mark a Stress.

features.name: Momentum
features.description: When the Scorpion makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

name: Glass Snake
description: A clear serpent with a massive head that leaves behind a glass shard trail wherever they go.

features.name: Armor-Shredding Shards
features.description: On a successful attack within Melee range against the Snake, the attacker must mark an Armor Slot without receiving its benefits (they can still use armor to reduce the damage). If they can’t mark an Armor Slot, they must mark an additional HP.

features.name: Spinning Serpent
features.description: Mark a Stress to make an attack against all targets within Very Close range. Targets the Snake succeeds against take 1d6+1 physical damage.

features.name: Spitter
features.description: Spend a Fear to introduce a d6 Spitter Die. When the Snake is in the spotlight, roll this die. On a result of 5 or higher, all targets in front of the Snake within Far range must succeed on an Agility Reaction Roll or take 1d4 physical damage. The Snake can take the spotlight a second time this GM turn.

name: Harrier
description: A nimble fighter armed with javelins.

features.name: Maintain Distance
features.description: After making a standard attack, the Harrier can move anywhere within Far range.

features.name: Fall Back
features.description: When a creature moves into Melee range to make an attack, you can mark a Stress before the attack roll to move anywhere within Close range and make an attack against that creature. On a success, deal 1d10+2 physical damage.

name: Archer Guard
description: A tall guard bearing a longbow and quiver with arrows fletched in the settlement’s colors.

features.name: Hobbling Shot
features.description: Make an attack against a target within Far range. On a success, mark a Stress to deal 1d12+3 physical damage. If the target marks HP from this attack, they have disadvantage on Agility Rolls until they clear at least 1 HP.

name: Bladed Guard
description: An armored guard bearing a sword and shield painted in the settlement’s colors.

features.name: Shield Wall
features.description: A creature who tries to move within Very Close range of the Guard must succeed on an Agility Roll. If additional Bladed Guards are standing in a line alongside the first, and each is within Melee range of another guard in the line, the Difficulty increases by the total number of guards in that line.

features.name: Detain
features.description: Make an attack against a target within Very Close range. On a success, mark a Stress to Restrain the target until they break free with a successful attack, Finesse Roll, or Strength Roll.

name: Head Guard
description: A seasoned guard with a mace, a whistle, and a bellowing voice.

features.name: Rally Guards
features.description: Spend 2 Fear to spotlight the Head Guard and up to 2d4 allies within Far range.

features.name: On My Signal
features.description: Countdown (5). When the Head Guard is in the spotlight for the first time, activate the countdown. It ticks down when a PC makes an attack roll. When it triggers, all Archer Guards within Far range make a standard attack with advantage against the nearest target within their range. If any attacks succeed on the same target, combine their damage.

features.name: Momentum
features.description: When the Head Guard makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

name: Jagged Knife Bandit
description: A cunning criminal in a cloak bearing one of the gang’s iconic knives.

features.name: Climber
features.description: The Bandit climbs just as easily as they run.

features.name: From Above
features.description: When the Bandit succeeds on a standard attack from above a target, they deal 1d10+1 physical damage instead of their standard damage.

name: Jagged Knife Hexer
description: A staff-wielding bandit in a cloak adorned with magical paraphernalia, using curses to vex their foes.

features.name: Curse
features.description: Choose a target within Far range and temporarily Curse them. While the target is Cursed, you can mark a Stress when that target rolls with Hope to make the roll be with Fear instead.

features.name: Chaotic Flux
features.description: Make an attack against up to three targets within Very Close range. Mark a Stress to deal 2d6+3 magic damage to targets the Hexer succeeded against.

name: Jagged Knife Kneebreaker
description: An imposing brawler carrying a large club.

features.name: I’ve Got ’Em
features.description: Creatures Restrained by the Kneebreaker take double damage from attacks by other adversaries.

features.name: Hold Them Down
features.description: Make an attack against a target within Melee range. On a success, the target takes no damage but is Restrained and Vulnerable. The target can break free, clearing both conditions, with a successful Strength Roll or is freed automatically if the Kneebreaker takes Major or greater damage.

name: Jagged Knife Lackey
description: A thief with simple clothes and small daggers, eager to prove themselves.

features.name: Minion
features.description: The Lackey is defeated when they take any damage. For every 3 damage a PC deals to the Lackey, defeat an additional Minion within range the attack would succeed against.

features.name: Group Attack
features.description: Spend a Fear to choose a target and spotlight all Jagged Knife Lackeys within Close range of them. Those Minions move into Melee range of the target and make one shared attack roll. On a success, they deal 2 physical damage each. Combine this damage.

name: Jagged Knife Lieutenant
description: A seasoned bandit in quality leathers with a strong voice and cunning eyes.

features.name: Tactician
features.description: When you spotlight the Lieutenant, mark a Stress to also spotlight two allies within Close range.

features.name: More Where That Came From
features.description: Summon three Jagged Knife Lackeys, who appear at Far range.

features.name: Coup de Grace
features.description: Spend a Fear to make an attack against a Vulnerable target within Close range. On a success, deal 2d6+12 physical damage and the target must mark a Stress.

features.name: Momentum
features.description: When the Lieutenant makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

name: Jagged Knife Shadow
description: A nimble scoundrel bearing a wicked knife and utilizing shadow magic to isolate targets.

features.name: Backstab
features.description: When the Shadow succeeds on a standard attack that has advantage, they deal 1d6+6 physical damage instead of their standard damage.

features.name: Cloaked
features.description: Become Hidden until after the Shadow’s next attack. Attacks made while Hidden from this feature have advantage.

name: Jagged Knife Sniper
description: A lanky bandit striking from cover with a shortbow.

features.name: Unseen Strike
features.description: If the Sniper is Hidden when they make a successful standard attack against a target, they deal 1d10+4 physical damage instead of their standard damage.

name: Merchant
description: A finely dressed trader with a keen eye for financial gain.

features.name: Preferential Treatment
features.description: A PC who succeeds on a Presence Roll against the Merchant gains a discount on purchases. A PC who fails on a Presence Roll against the Merchant must pay more and has disadvantage on future Presence Rolls against the Merchant.

features.name: The Runaround
features.description: When a PC rolls a 14 or lower on a Presence Roll made against the Merchant, they must mark a Stress.

name: Minor Chaos Elemental
description: A coruscating mass of uncontrollable magic.

features.name: Arcane Form
features.description: The Elemental is resistant to magic damage.

features.name: Sickening Flux
features.description: Mark a HP to force all targets within Close range to mark a Stress and become Vulnerable until their next rest or they clear a HP.

features.name: Remake Reality
features.description: Spend a Fear to transform the area within Very Close range into a different biome. All targets within this area take 2d6+3 direct magic damage.

features.name: Magical Reflection
features.description: When the Elemental takes damage from an attack within Close range, deal an amount of damage to the attacker equal to half the damage they dealt.

features.name: Momentum
features.description: When the Elemental makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

name: Minor Fire Elemental
description: A living flame the size of a large bonfire.

features.name: Relentless
features.description: The Elemental can be spotlighted up to two times per GM turn. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

features.name: Scorched Earth
features.description: Mark a Stress to choose a point within Far range. The ground within Very Close range of that point immediately bursts into fl ames. All creatures within this area must make an Agility Reaction Roll. Targets who fail take 2d8 magic damage from the fl ames. Targets who succeed take half damage.

features.name: Explosion
features.description: Spend a Fear to erupt in a fiery explosion. Make an attack against all targets within Close range. Targets the Elemental succeeds against take 1d8 magic damage and are knocked back to Far range.

features.name: Consume Kindling
features.description: Three times per scene, when the Elemental moves onto objects that are highly flammable, consume them to clear a HP or a Stress.

features.name: Momentum
features.description: When the Elemental makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

name: Minor Demon
description: A crimson-hued creature from the Circles Below, consumed by rage against all mortals.

features.name: Relentless
features.description: The Demon can be spotlighted up to two times per GM turn. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

features.name: All Must Fall
features.description: When a PC rolls a failure with Fear while within Close range of the Demon, they lose a Hope.

features.name: Hellfire
features.description: Spend a Fear to rain down hellfire within Far range. All targets within the area must make an Agility Reaction Roll. Targets who fail take 1d20+3 magic damage. Targets who succeed take half damage.

features.name: Reaper
features.description: Before rolling damage for the Demon’s attack, you can mark a Stress to gain a bonus to the damage roll equal to the Demon’s current number of marked HP.

features.name: Momentum
features.description: When the Demon makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

name: Minor Treant
description: An ambulatory sapling rising up to defend their forest.

features.name: Minion
features.description: The Treant is defeated when they take any damage. For every 5 damage a PC deals to the Treant, defeat an additional Minion within range the attack would succeed against.

features.name: Group Attack
features.description: Spend a Fear to choose a target and spotlight all Minor Treants within Close range of them. Those Minions move into Melee range of the target and make one shared attack roll. On a success, they deal 4 physical damage each. Combine this damage.

name: Green Ooze
description: A moving mound of translucent green slime.

features.name: Slow
features.description: When you spotlight the Ooze and they don’t have a token on their stat block, they can’t act yet. Place a token on their stat block and describe what they’re preparing to do. When you spotlight the Ooze and they have a token on their stat block, clear the token and they can act.

features.name: Acidic Form
features.description: When the Ooze makes a successful attack, the target must mark an Armor Slot without receiving its benefits (they can still use armor to reduce the damage). If they can’t mark an Armor Slot, they must mark an additional HP.

features.name: Envelop
features.description: Make a standard attack against a target within Melee range. On a success, the Ooze envelops them and the target must mark 2 Stress. The target must mark an additional Stress when they make an action roll. If the Ooze takes Severe damage, the target is freed.

features.name: Split
features.description: When the Ooze has 3 or more HP marked, you can spend a Fear to split them into two Tiny Green Oozes (with no marked HP or Stress). Immediately spotlight both of them.

name: Tiny Green Ooze
description: A small moving mound of translucent green slime.

features.name: Acidic Form
features.description: When the Ooze makes a successful attack, the target must mark an Armor Slot without receiving its benefits (they can still use armor to reduce the damage). If they can’t mark an Armor Slot, they must mark an additional HP.

name: Red Ooze
description: A moving mound of translucent flaming red slime.

features.name: Creeping Fire
features.description: The Ooze can only move within Very Close range as their normal movement. They light any flammable object they touch on fire.

features.name: Ignite
features.description: Make an attack against a target within Very Close range. On a success, the target takes 1d8 magic damage and is Ignited until they’re extinguished with a successful Finesse Roll (14). While Ignited, the target takes 1d4 magic damage when they make an action roll.

features.name: Split
features.description: When the Ooze has 3 or more HP marked, you can spend a Fear to split them into two Tiny Red Oozes (with no marked HP or Stress). Immediately spotlight both of them.

name: Tiny Red Ooze
description: A small moving mound of translucent flaming red slime

features.name: Burning
features.description: When a creature within Melee range deals damage to the Ooze, they take 1d6 direct magic damage.

name: Petty Noble
description: A richly dressed and adorned aristocrat brimming with hubris.

features.name: My Land, My Rules
features.description: All social actions made against the Noble on their land have disadvantage.

features.name: Guards, Seize Them!
features.description: Once per scene, mark a Stress to summon 1d4 Bladed Guards, who appear at Far range to enforce the Noble’s will.

features.name: Exile
features.description: Spend a Fear and target a PC. The Noble proclaims that the target and their allies are exiled from the noble’s territory. While exiled, the target and their allies have disadvantage during social situations within the Noble’s domain.

name: Pirate Captain
description: A charismatic sea dog with an impressive hat, eager to raid and plunder.

features.name: Swashbuckler
features.description: When the Captain marks 2 or fewer HP from an attack within Melee range, the attacker must mark a Stress.

features.name: Reinforcements
features.description: Once per scene, mark a Stress to summon a Pirate Raiders Horde, which appears at Far range.

features.name: No Quarter
features.description: Spend a Fear to choose a target who has three or more Pirates within Melee range of them. The Captain leads the Pirates in hurling threats and promises of a watery grave. The target must make a Presence Reaction Roll. On a failure, the target marks 1d4+1 Stress. On a success, they must mark a Stress.

features.name: Momentum
features.description: When the Captain makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

name: Pirate Raiders
description: Seafaring scoundrels moving in a ravaging pack.

features.name: Horde
features.description: When the Raiders have marked half or more of their HP, their standard attack deals 1d4+1 physical damage instead.

features.name: Swashbuckler
features.description: When the Raiders mark 2 or fewer HP from an attack within Melee range, the attacker must mark a Stress.

name: Pirate Tough
description: A thickly muscled and tattooed pirate with melon-sized fi sts.

features.name: Swashbuckler
features.description: When the Tough marks 2 or fewer HP from an attack within Melee range, the attacker must mark a Stress.

features.name: Clear the Decks
features.description: Make an attack against a target within Very Close range. On a success, mark a Stress to move into Melee range of the target, dealing 3d4 physical damage and knocking the target back to Close range.

name: Sellsword
description: An armed mercenary testing their luck.

features.name: Minion
features.description: The Sellsword is defeated when they take any damage. For every 4 damage a PC deals to the Sellsword, defeat an additional Minion within range the attack would succeed against.

features.name: Group Attack
features.description: Spend a Fear to choose a target and spotlight all Sellswords within Close range of them. Those Minions move into Melee range of the target and make one shared attack roll. On a success, they deal 3 physical damage each. Combine this damage.

name: Skeleton Archer
description: A fragile skeleton with a shortbow and arrows.

features.name: Opportunist
features.description: When two or more adversaries are within Very Close range of a creature, all damage the Archer deals to that creature is doubled.

features.name: Deadly Shot
features.description: Make an attack against a Vulnerable target within Far range. On a success, mark a Stress to deal 3d4+8 physical damage.

name: Skeleton Dredge
description: A clattering pile of bones.

features.name: Minion
features.description: The Dredge is defeated when they take any damage. For every 4 damage a PC deals to the Dredge, defeat an additional Minion within range the attack would succeed against.

features.name: Group Attack
features.description: Spend a Fear to choose a target and spotlight all Dredges within Close range of them. Those Minions move into Melee range of the target and make one shared attack roll. On a success, they deal 1 physical damage each. Combine this damage.

name: Skeleton Knight
description: A large armored skeleton with a huge blade.

features.name: Terrifying
features.description: When the Knight makes a successful attack, all PCs within Close range lose a Hope and you gain a Fear.

features.name: Cut to the Bone
features.description: Mark a Stress to make an attack against all targets within Very Close range. Targets the Knight succeeds against take 1d8+2 physical damage and must mark a Stress.

features.name: Dig Two Graves
features.description: When the Knight is defeated, they make an attack against a target within Very Close range (prioritizing the creature who killed them). On a success, the target takes 1d4+8 physical damage and loses 1d4 Hope.

name: Skeleton Warrior
description: A dirt-covered skeleton armed with a rusted blade.

features.name: Only Bones
features.description: The Warrior is resistant to physical damage.

features.name: Won’t Stay Dead
features.description: When the Warrior is defeated, you can spotlight them and roll a d6. On a result of 6, if there are other adversaries on the battlefield, the Warrior re-forms with no marked HP.

name: Spellblade
description: A mercenary combining swordplay and magic to deadly effect.

features.name: Arcane Steel
features.description: Damage dealt by the Spellblade’s standard attack is considered both physical and magic.

features.name: Suppressing Blast
features.description: Mark a Stress and target a group within Far range. All targets must succeed on an Agility Reaction Roll or take 1d8+2 magic damage. You gain a Fear for each target who marked HP from this attack.

features.name: Move as a Unit
features.description: Spend 2 Fear to spotlight up to five allies within Far range.

features.name: Momentum
features.description: When the Spellblade makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

name: Swarm Of Rats
description: A skittering mass of ordinary rodents moving as one like a ravenous wave.

features.name: Horde
features.description: When the Swarm has marked half or more of their HP, their standard attack deals 1d4+1 physical damage instead.

features.name: In Your Face
features.description: All targets within Melee range have disadvantage on attacks against targets other than the Swarm.

name: Sylvan Soldier
description: A faerie warrior adorned in armor made of leaves and bark.

features.name: Pack Tactics
features.description: If the Soldier makes a standard attack and another Sylvan Soldier is within Melee range of the target, deal 1d8+5 physical damage instead of their standard damage.

features.name: Forest Control
features.description: Spend a Fear to pull down a tree within Close range. A creature hit by the tree must succeed on an Agility Reaction Roll (15) or take 1d10 physical damage.

features.name: Blend In
features.description: When the Soldier makes a successful attack, you can mark a Stress to become Hidden until the Soldier’s next attack or a PC succeeds on an Instinct Roll (14) to find them.

name: Tangle Bramble Swarm
description: A cluster of animate, blood-drinking tumbleweeds, each the size of a large gourd.

features.name: Horde
features.description: When the Swarm has marked half or more of their HP, their standard attack deals 1d4+2 physical damage instead.

features.name: Crush
features.description: Mark a Stress to deal 2d6+8 direct physical damage to a target with 3 or more bramble tokens.

features.name: Encumber
features.description: When the Swarm succeeds on an attack, give the target a bramble token. If a target has any bramble tokens, they are Restrained. If a target has 3 or more bramble tokens, they are also Vulnerable. All bramble tokens can be removed by succeeding on a Finesse Roll (12 + the number of bramble tokens) or dealing Major or greater damage to the Swarm. If bramble tokens are removed from a target using a Finesse Roll, a number of Tangle Bramble Minions spawn within Melee range equal to the number of tokens removed.

name: Tangle Bramble
description: An animate, blood-drinking tumbleweed.

features.name: Minion
features.description: The Bramble is defeated when they take any damage. For every 4 damage a PC deals to the Tangle Bramble, defeat an additional Minion within range the attack would succeed against.

features.name: Group Attack
features.description: Spend a Fear to choose a target and spotlight all Tangle Brambles within Close range of them. Those Minions move into Melee range of the target and make one shared attack roll. On a success, they deal 2 physical damage each. Combine this damage.

features.name: Drain and Multiply
features.description: When an attack from the Bramble causes a target to mark HP and there are three or more Tangle Bramble Minions within Close range, you can combine the Minions into a Tangle Bramble Swarm Horde. The Horde’s HP is equal to the number of Minions combined.

name: Weaponmaster
description: A master-at-arms wielding a sword twice their size.

features.name: Goading Strike
features.description: Make a standard attack against a target. On a success, mark a Stress to Taunt the target until their next successful attack. The next time the Taunted target attacks, they have disadvantage against targets other than the Weaponmaster.

features.name: Adrenaline Burst
features.description: Once per scene, spend a Fear to clear 2 HP and 2 Stress.

features.name: Momentum
features.description: When the Weaponmaster makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

name: Young Dryad
description: An imperious tree-person leading their forest’s defenses.

features.name: Voice of the Forest
features.description: Mark a Stress to spotlight 1d4 allies within range of a target they can attack without moving. On a success, their attacks deal half damage.

features.name: Thorny Cage
features.description: Spend a Fear to form a cage around a target within Very Close range and Restrain them until they’re freed with a successful Strength Roll. When a creature makes an action roll against the cage, they must mark a Stress.

features.name: Momentum
features.description: When the Dryad makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

name: Brawny Zombie
description: A large corpse, decay-bloated and angry.

features.name: Slow
features.description: When you spotlight the Zombie and they don’t have a token on their stat block, they can’t act yet. Place a token on their stat block and describe what they’re preparing to do. When you spotlight the Zombie and they have a token on their stat block, clear the token and they can act.

features.name: Rend Asunder
features.description: Make a standard attack with advantage against a target the Zombie has Restrained. On a success, the attack deals direct damage.

features.name: Rip and Tear
features.description: When the Zombies makes a successful standard attack, you can mark a Stress to temporarily Restrain the target and force them to mark 2 Stress.

name: Patchwork Zombie Hulk
description: A towering gestalt of corpses moving as one, with torso-sized limbs and fists as large as a grown halfling.

features.name: Destructible
features.description: When the Zombie takes Major or greater damage, they mark an additional HP.

features.name: Flailing Limbs
features.description: When the Zombie makes a standard attack, they can attack all targets within Very Close range.

features.name: Another for the Pile
features.description: When the Zombie is within Very Close range of a corpse, they can incorporate it into themselves, clearing a HP and a Stress.

features.name: Tormented Screams
features.description: Mark a Stress to cause all PCs within Far range to make a Presence Reaction Roll (13). Targets who fail lose a Hope and you gain a Fear for each. Targets who succeed must mark a Stress.

name: Rotted Zombie
description: A decaying corpse ambling toward their prey.

features.name: Minion
features.description: The Zombie is defeated when they take any damage. For every 3 damage a PC deals to the Zombie, defeat an additional Minion within range the attack would succeed against.

features.name: Group Attack
features.description: Spend a Fear to choose a target and spotlight all Rotted Zombies within Close range of them. Those Minions move into Melee range of the target and make one shared attack roll. On a success, they deal 2 physical damage each. Combine this damage.

name: Shambling Zombie
description: An animated corpse that moves shakily, driven only by hunger.

features.name: Too Many to Handle
features.description: When the Zombie is within Melee range of a creature and at least one other Zombie is within Close range, all attacks against that creature have advantage.

features.name: Horrifying
features.description: Targets who mark HP from the Zombie’s attacks must also mark a Stress.
